OptionChoice.name: enableMimicry
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Mimicry ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Mimicry ores.
Mimicry ores will be handled by Minecraft directly.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpMimicry
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Mimicry ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Mimicry ores.
Mimicry ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Mimichite is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: mcryMimichiteFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Mimicry Mimichite distributions

OptionNumeric.name: mcryMimichiteSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Mimicry Mimichite distributions

OptionChoice.name: mcryMountainMimichiteDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Mountain Mimichite is generated

Choice.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Mountain Mimichite is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: mcryMountainMimichiteFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Mimicry Mountain Mimichite distributions

OptionNumeric.name: mcryMountainMimichiteSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Mimicry Mountain Mimichite distributions

OptionChoice.name: mcryNetherMimichiteDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Nether Mimichite is generated

Choice.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Nether Mimichite is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: mcryNetherMimichiteFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Mimicry Nether Mimichite distributions

OptionNumeric.name: mcryNetherMimichiteSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Mimicry Nether Mimichite distributions

OptionChoice.name: mcryEndMimichiteDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how End Mimichite is generated

Choice.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: End Mimichite is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: mcryEndMimichiteFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Mimicry End Mimichite distributions

OptionNumeric.name: mcryEndMimichiteSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Mimicry End Mimichite distributions

Substitute.name: mcryOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: mcryMimichiteVeins
Veins.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore. Because they contain less ore per volume, these veins are relatively wide and long. Mining the ore from them is time consuming compared to solid ore veins. They are also more difficult to follow, since it is harder to get an idea of their direction while mining.

Cloud.name: mcryMimichiteCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: mcryMimichiteHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: mcryMimichiteStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.
